sense.name: financial aid given to support some undertaking
sense.examples: The professor has brought in about 2 million dollars in grants. Mary is applying for a NIH grant to support her research. These grants are given by private corporations to stimulate enterprise zones. The government has 25 million dollars in block grants.

sense.name: the act of allowing, bestowing something
sense.examples: The fairy godmother's grant of three wishes to the girl is the central plot of the story. The governor's grant of a stay of execution came as a surprise. They had to recommend either the grant or the refusal of broadcast licenses.

sense.name: a legal transfer of property
sense.examples: The government's land grants accelerated development and settlement of the west. John's right to the family farm was established through a grant of probate. Bob has the beer grant at the baseball park. (contractual right to run concession there)

sense.name: a minor geographical subdivision of Maine, Vermont or New Hampshire
sense.examples: This old stone wall delineates one side of an early grant in Maine. That grant in Vermont includes several dairy farms and a river running between them.
